user_query: Can I pay by cash?
assistant_response: Cash payments are not accepted, including paying in cash over the counter in bank branches and using services of third-party providers like payment agencies.

user_query: How can I play with QR code?
assistant_response: To pay with a QR code using the Wise app, you can swipe left on the image of your card in the Card tab to bring up the option to Pay with QR code or Pay like a local. Then, you can either scan a QR code with the Wise app camera or import a QR code from your phone gallery. Follow the steps to confirm your payment, and you can review the payment anytime under your transaction list in the Wise app.

assistant_response: You can repeat a transfer by selecting the option to repeat the transfer from three different places: directly from the transfer details page when logged into your Wise account, from the transfer page of a completed transfer, or from the payment confirmation page accessed through the transfer status link in the email sent after a transfer is completed. This will create a new transfer with the same details as the previous one, including the current mid-market exchange rate.

user_query: How can I do the wire transfer?
assistant_response: You can make a wire payment to Wise by setting up your transfer to Wise and ensuring that the name on the bank account where the money is coming from matches your name on Wise. Additionally, you should follow the instructions provided by Wise to send the payment to their account.

user_query: How can I pay money with wise
assistant_response: You can pay money with Wise by selecting the recipient, entering the transfer amount and currency, choosing how to pay, reviewing the details, and confirming the transfer. Wise does not accept cash payments, checks, or payments over the phone.

user_query: How can I pay my money with device?
assistant_response: You can pay using your device by setting up a transfer as usual and selecting the Apple Pay or Google Pay option at the payment step. Follow the steps to confirm the payment using either Apple Pay or Google Pay, depending on your device.

user_query: How can I share money with VICE?
assistant_response: You can't share money with VICE using Wise, as VICE is a media company and not a payment recipient.

user_query: Can I share the larger amount?
assistant_response: Yes, you can share a larger amount by either going to your bank branch in person, calling your bank to increase the limit for a short amount of time, adding several smaller amounts to your balance over a few days, or setting up a transfer for the full amount and paying for it in several smaller amounts.

user_query: can I get my documents approved before I send
assistant_response: You cannot get your documents approved before you send a transfer. The approval of documents is done on a case-by-case basis, and the necessary documents are reviewed only after the transfer has been initiated.

user_query: Can I get my document approved before I send?

user_query: How can I send money from a balance?
assistant_response: You can send money from a balance by selecting the balance you want to send from, choosing who you want to send the money to, entering the amount, confirming the transaction, and then completing the process by entering your Wise password or using fingerprint or facial recognition.

user_query: What are schedule transfers?
assistant_response: Scheduled transfers are transfers that can be set up to be sent out at a later date of your choice. You can schedule these transfers to be sent from your Wise balance or an external account, and choose the frequency of the transfer (one-time, monthly, bi-weekly, weekly). The scheduled date of the transfer is when the money is sent out, not necessarily when the recipient will receive it.

user_query: How can I send money from Telugu?
assistant_response: You cannot send money directly from Telugu. To send money with Wise, you need to sign up, add a recipient, enter the transfer amount, choose how to pay, review the details, and confirm the transfer.
